body_html:
PS, me + @scott-gray gave up on compiling TF as a submodule for a custom cuda op because of similar snags

IE, bazel select isn't context sensitive to the workspace it's defined in, and TF cuda macros use select --
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41153199/building-a-tensorflow-based-android-app-with-tensorflow-as-a-repository
body_text:
PS, me + @scott-gray gave up on compiling TF as a submodule for a custom cuda op because of similar snags
IE, bazel select isn't context sensitive to the workspace it's defined in, and TF cuda macros use  select --
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41153199/building-a-tensorflow-based-android-app-with-tensorflow-as-a-repository
body:
PS, me + @scott-gray gave up on compiling TF as a submodule for a custom cuda op because of similar snags


IE, bazel select isn't context sensitive to the workspace it's defined in, and TF cuda macros use  `select` --
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41153199/building-a-tensorflow-based-android-app-with-tensorflow-as-a-repository
